tool.name: 464 Questionnaire
tool.command:
cpt_464_questions.py --name "$name" --seq_cov "$seq_cov" --morph "$morph" --host "$host" --host_range "$host_range" --sample_type "$sample_type" --date "$date" --location "$location" --isolator "$isolator" --annotator "$annotator" --last_annotated "$last_annotated" --genome_length $genome_length --cdss $cdss --cdss_assigned $cdss_assigned --cdss_hypo_novel $cdss_hypo_novel --cdss_hypo_consv $cdss_hypo_consv --coding_density $coding_density --pigs $pigs --gc $gc --trna $trna --terminators $terminators --missing_core "$missing_core" --no_phage_homos "$no_phage_homos"
#set repeat_var_24 = '" "'.join([ str($var.unusual) for $var in $repeat_24 ]) --unusual "$repeat_var_24"
#set repeat_var_25 = '" "'.join([ str($var.no_sd) for $var in $repeat_25 ]) --no_sd "$repeat_var_25"
#set repeat_var_26 = '" "'.join([ str($var.gaps) for $var in $repeat_26 ]) --gaps "$repeat_var_26"
--closed "$closed" --reopened "$reopened" --sim "$sim" --gc_skew "$gc_skew" --trna_genes "$trna_genes" --email $__user_email__
> $default

param.label: Are there any core genes missing or out of place? Identify and explain.
param.name: missing_core

param.label: Do you have any gene with assigned function that has no phage sequence homolog? We are interested in "bacteria only" hits--this does not include your hypothetical novel genes. Justify the inclusion of bacteria-only annotations.
param.name: no_phage_homos

param.label: What unusual or unexpected genes or genomic features did you find? (e.g., morons, introns, inteins, invertible sequences, etc. and genes that have unique features
param.name: unusual

param.label: Do you have any genes without a legitimate (sequence and spacing) Shine-Dalgarno? If so, for each gene, justify retaining them in the genome (i.e. does it have a conserved gene product?).
param.name: no_sd

param.label: Justify any intergenic gap larger than 150 bp. (explain why you did not annotate genes?)
param.name: gaps

param.label: Is your genome closed? How do you know?
param.name: closed

param.label: Has your phage genome been re-opened? If so, where and why? If not, why not?
param.name: reopened

param.label: Is your phage similar to another phage? Which one? How similar? How was the similarity determined?
param.name: sim

param.label: Does your phage exhibit GC skew? Can you approximate an origin of replication? (Open your genome in Artemis, go to "Graph"->"GC Deviation". Use the right scroll bar to adjust the window to 5000. Scroll through your genome to see if and where your deviation line crosses from positive to negative.) Does this origin fit with the location of DNA replication genes?
param.name: gc_skew

param.label: Do you have any tRNA genes?
param.name: trna_genes

tool.help:
Fill out questions, run as many times as you need!
These questions are intended to reinforce key concepts that should be part of your GenomeA papers.
